name: ho
content:
ho

noun
 
/həʊ/
 
/həʊ/
(plural hos, hoes)
(North American English, taboo, offensive, slang)
jump to other results
  1. a woman who works as a prostitute
  2. an offensive word for a woman who you dislike or who you think has sex with a lot of men
    3. see also ho ho
    Word OriginShort form of whore.
Check pronunciation: ho

name: holmium
content:
holmium

noun
 
/ˈhəʊlmiəm/
 
/ˈhəʊlmiəm/
[uncountable]
(symbol Ho)
jump to other results
  1. a chemical element. Holmium is a soft silver-white metal.
    Word Originlate 19th cent.: modern Latin, from Holmia, Latinized form of Stockholm (because many minerals of the yttrium group, to which holmium belongs, are found in that area); discovered by P.T. Cleve, Swedish chemist (1840–1905).
See holmium in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary
Check pronunciation: holmium

name: ho ho
content:
ho ho

exclamation
 
/ˌhəʊ ˈhəʊ/
 
/ˌhəʊ ˈhəʊ/
jump to other results
  1. used to show the sound of a deep laugh
  2. used to show surprise or triumph, especially at a discovery
    • Ho, ho! What have we here?
    3. see also gung-ho, heave-ho, tally-ho
    Word Originmid 16th cent.: reduplication of ho.

name: gung-ho
content:
gung-ho

adjective
 
/ˌɡʌŋ ˈhəʊ/
 
/ˌɡʌŋ ˈhəʊ/
(informal, disapproving)
jump to other results
  1. too enthusiastic about something, without thinking seriously about it, especially about fighting and war
    • Many people found her gung-ho attitude to the war deeply offensive.
    Word OriginSecond World War: from Chinese gōnghé, taken to mean ‘work together’ and adopted as a slogan by US Marines.
See gung-ho in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary
Check pronunciation: gung-ho

name: heave-ho
content:
heave-ho

noun
 
/ˌhiːv ˈhəʊ/
 
/ˌhiːv ˈhəʊ/
Word Originlate Middle English: from heave! (imperative) + ho (used to draw attention to something seen), originally in nautical use when hauling a rope.
[singular]Idioms
jump to other results
Idioms
give somebody the (old) heave-ho
  1. (informal) to dismiss somebody from their job; to end a relationship with somebody
See heave-ho in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary
Check pronunciation: heave-ho

name: tally-ho
content:
tally-ho

exclamation
 
/ˌtæli ˈhəʊ/
 
/ˌtæli ˈhəʊ/
jump to other results
  1. used in hunting for telling the dogs that a fox has been seen
    Word Originlate 18th cent.: apparently an alteration of French taïaut, of unknown origin.
Check pronunciation: tally-ho
